Description: Major office and lab construction, office move and consolidation
Description‡: 大型オフィス及びラボ工事、２つの事務所を引っ越させ1つにする
Project Background: Management determined that a lab is needed in Japan, and this project entails building an office and lab, and moving two offices into 1,231 m<sup>2</sup> (13250 ft<sup>2</sup>) of leased space. Electron Microscopes are extremely sensitive instruments which need a tightly controlled environment, so the construction of the lab area had to be completed to a very strict specification.
Project Background‡: マネージメントは日本にラボが必要だと判断し、このプロジェクトは、新事務所とラボの工事をしてから、二つの事務所を新しい1つの1,231 m<sup>2</sup>事務所に引っ越させる。
Problem:
* sensitive lab instruments need a tightly-controlled environment, with regard to vibration and humidity.
* lab engineers require data for temp, humidity and oxygen.
* delivery of heavy lab equipment requires reinforced floor.
* lab floor must be anti-static and anti-chemical in certain areas. 
* water is being piped to the tools, so there is a risk of damage from flooding.
Solution:
* tight control of building location selection, and strict specification of HVAC environment control
* devices deployed to measure temp, humidity and oxygen, and data stored in eSolia cloud db "[PROdb](https://esolia.com/prodb)".
* floor reinforced by steel plates to allow delivery of heavy lab equipment. 
* special anti-static, anti-chemical flooring poured over slab. 
* a water "rope" is in use to shut off water flow if flooding is detected.
Benefits:
* final lab area is a true showcase and designed specifically to supply the environment that the electron microscopes need.
* environment data is available to lab engineers, and a report is sent automatically on a regular basis. 
* damage is limited by auto-shutoff of water pipes, when flooding is detected.
Technology:
* special HVAC units installed to control humidity.
* Chemicrete liquid flooring.
* sensors that collect data on temp, humidity, water leakage and oxygen level.
